summary: This is a business record certification from Municipal Credit Union responding to a subpoena duces tecum in the Epstein case. It certifies the accuracy and completeness of financial records produced, noting that checks and credit card statements are not applicable and that SARs/CTRs will be handled separately.

persons.name: Danielle Jones
persons.context: Authorized custodian of records at Municipal Credit Union who certifies the accuracy and completeness of documents produced in response to a subpoena.

persons.name: Patricia Gonzalez
persons.context: Notary Public who notarized the certification document, qualified in Queens County, New York.

events.title: Business Record Certification for Subpoena Response
events.description: Municipal Credit Union certifies production of financial records in response to a subpoena duces tecum related to the Epstein case, noting checks and credit card statements are not applicable.

keyFacts: Municipal Credit Union responded to a subpoena duces tecum in the Epstein case with certified business records.
The certification states that checks and credit card statements are 'Not Applicable' among the records produced.
Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) and Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs) are not included in this production and will be handled separately by the BSA Department.
The document was notarized by Patricia Gonzalez, a Notary Public qualified in Queens County, New York.
